page.title: 16THE INDUSTRIAL ESTATE
page.content: This situated in grid squares 52 89 and 53 89, west of the A12 trunk road and is called South Lowestoft Industrial Estate. Development of this site began in 1971/72 on land which had previously been used for agriculture. The estate is owned by Waveney District Council who sell or lease units to interested firms. At present the Estate covers an area of 76 acres and the completed Estate should occupy 100 acres. There are 106 units on the site of various sizes and most of these are occupied. Occupiers include small, local firms and subsidiaries of large, national enterprises. Examples of {industries} which are conducted from the Estate are light engineering, haulage contractors, sports and equipment {manufacturing}, taxi hire, fish merchants and metal fabrication.
